name: Hotel Le Clos Medicis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent a weekend at the Clos Medicis, which we had booked more or less by chance after trying without success to book a room at several other places we normally stay. At 280 euros a night in high season, Clos Medicis was a bit outside our normal range, but in the end we were very happy with the choice and had a great weekend. Our room (#65) was on the top floor, with a very comfortable bed, and was in fact a duplex, with a well designed bathroom on the second floor. Staff were extremely polite and pleasant, and we were treated very well, from arrival to departure. The next time we decide to splurge on a Paris weekend, we will certainly try to book here again.
reviews.title: Great weekend at Clos Medicis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Clos Medicis location was also unbeatable, around the corner from Jardin du Luxembourg, but in quiet street (we had no problems sleeping), 10 minutes walking to Notre Dame, 15 to the Louvre. Rue Monsieur Prince had many restaurants, and was surrounded by great bookshops.
reviews.title: NICE AND COZY HOTEL IN SAINT GERMAIN

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This charming hotel is a gem in St. Germain. My room was single, very Small space like other large city in the world, but very comfortable with all the amenities you need.
reviews.title: I'll be back before the end of the year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very very friendly and always had a very good tips from all the front desk staff.
reviews.title: Quaint & Intimate and would definitely return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is warm and welcoming from the moment you arrive. My room - double for single occupancy - was much bigger than I've ever had at this price in Paris. And I've been to this fabulous city many times. It's in a fantastic position - just a hop over from Place de la Sorbonne, around the corner from the Luxembourg Gardens and a stroll from the Seine. RER Luxembourg is very close and buses are good too. I was lucky and had one of the two hotel balconies. I booked up many months ago and specially requested it. Paris was very very hot last weekend so I loved being able to sit out. Breakfast al fresco was a treat - good coffee and a decent continental selection at a reasonable price. The shower room was bigger than you come to expect in Paris too. I'd strongly recommend it.
reviews.title: Great small hotel in perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Le Clos Medicis is a brilliantly located and charming hotel property. The staff were friendly and helpful and helped make our stay in Paris one that we'll never forget. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others looking for a hotel that's within walking distance of many popular sites and of course some fantastic cafes and restaurants.
reviews.title: The final stage of our honeymoon was amazing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: Not the biggest rooms in the world but easy walk to Pantheon, Jardin de Luxembourg, Notre Dame and Batobus. Staff courteous and helpful. Use again - yes.
reviews.title: Good location, decent 'compact' hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Paris, staying only a couple of nights. Our priorities were to be in a safe neighborhood, near good walking streets, and excellent service - since we had such limited time, don't know the city, and aren't good French speakers. Based on other reviews, we chose Hotel Le Clos Medicis.
reviews.title: Comme ci comme ça - wouldn't stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Well. The location is great, it's true. St. Germain des Pres is a lovely neighborhood. The hotel is a block from Jardin Luxembourg park, formerly palace grounds - gorgeous, and a special bonus for kids because they can sail toy boats in one of the pools, see a puppet show, etc. There's a nice cafe on the corner (Luxembourg Cafe) to use as a homebase.
reviews.title: Attentive service in an unbelievably quiet hotel close to St Germain de Pres

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel was tiny but clean, with a chic little lounge and lobby. The idea that the little bar is open all the time is a bit sketch - you're dependent on whomever staffs the reception desk to come over and serve you (do all front desk staff train in mixing drinks?). We did not breakfast there, so I can't comment on that.
reviews.title: A very pleasant hotel in an ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is excellent, in the Latin Quarter close to the Jardin du Luxembourg on one side and lots of bustling bars and restaurants on the other. Notre Dame is an easy walk away and the rest of Paris accessible via the Metro. The hotel room was very small, but that is often the case in a central location in a European capital city. The room and hotel in general were well appointed and the room was clean. Light in the room was a little low for comfortable reading.
reviews.title: Good place to stay on Left Bank

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar/lobby had a pleasant sitting area with an open wood fire, which made it very welcoming. Service was polite, friendly and efficient throughout.
reviews.title: Small but beautiful hotel in St-Germain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a very effective base for a Paris visit.
reviews.title: Great location for walking around Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The "Clos Medicis" is a small hotel ideally situated in the calm and beautiful St-Germain quarter Paris. It is easily accessible by Underground Metro. There are many small restaurants around the hotel and the neighborhood is safe, even in the late evening.
reviews.title: A lovely find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel has a charming lobby with a fireplace, which is lit every evening in autumn and winter. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are quite small (which is normal in Paris) but very clean and quiet. We had a Kingsize bed and a Flatscreen TV in our room.
reviews.title: Great Location, Very nice Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had four nights at this hotel and were really pleased with our choice. It is in a great location, walking distance from the Louvre and Notre Dame and close to many bars and restaurants.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel reception features a wood burning fire and always felt very warm and welcoming when we returned from days out in the cold. It always smelt lovely too, I don't know what they used but it was gorgeous!
reviews.title: Clean, welcoming, convenient but a bit cramped

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the top floor and although small (as are most rooms in Parisian hotels I believe) it was comfortable and clean. Again it was always cosy in the cold weather but also had windows which you could open if necessary.
reviews.title: Experience a real Parisian Neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't bother with breakfast in the hotel as it wasn't included and there are plenty of options near to the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with EXCELLENT service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were professional and helpful.
reviews.title: Nice location, charming and relax

description: Located at the crossroads of Saint Germain des Pres and the Latin quarter the Clos Medicis is a 38 rooms property. All rooms provide, individual air-conditionning,strong box, minibar, free wifi access, flat screen TV and bathrobes. Buffet breakfast is served in guest room, breakfast room or on sunny days in the patio.A 24 hours bar service is available in the lobby, enjoy a drink in front of the burning fireplace.
